title: Mass-Density Formula
text: Given a thin rod oriented along the x-axis over the interval [a,b], let p(x) denote a linear density function giving the density of the rod at a point $$x$$ in the interval. Then the mass of the rod is given by $$m=\int_{a}^{b} p(x) \,dx$$
